result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac A. Antone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

Shall have no contact or communication with victim or victim's residence;  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Cases called 15CM501 and 16CM52.  Defendant Isaac A. Antone in court, in custody with attorney Ramneek S Button.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No corrections offered to revocation packet.  Atty. Tienstra heard on recommendation - offers photo exhibits.  Atty. Button is heard.  Mr. Antone makes statement.  Court is heard and sentence imposed: 

16CM52:
Court orders on counts 1,2,3,5,7:
9 months DCJ (concurrent to one another).
Civil judgment for costs/fees/restitution.

16CM501:
6 months, DCJ, consecutive to 16CM52.

191 days presentence credit applicable to each case.  
Jail commencing forthwith.

1:03 - Defendant Isaac A. Antone in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan (eligible).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Return date scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
